page.title: 07Law and Order
page.content: The old police station was opposite the Sun Inn in the village,and then moved opposite Chapel House. There has been a police house in{Bassenthwaite since 1860. There has not been much crime in Bassenthwaite, it is a very quiet place. The worst crime was when {Armathwaite Hall}was burgled in 1957- 58, Â£600 were taken. Many changes have occurred. The only means of communication was the local telephone. Now they use radios and computers which are based in their headquarters at Penrith, they are able to talk with all the stations and men in the county. There have been no police dogs in the area. The policeman's job is to uphold the law. He is appointed in the Queens name by the local police committee. He does not arrest people for things like riding their bike without a light,he just warns them.
